required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Recombinant Human Erythropoietin Dose, Serum Adiponectin, and All-Cause Mortality in Patients Beginning Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: Decreased body fat mass, possibly mediated through the effects of elevated serum adiponectin levels, may be associated with requirements for higher recombinant human erythropoietin doses and a subsequent worse prognosis in patients beginning hemodialysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who started hemodialysis therapy from August 2000 to May 2001 in 11 dialysis centers in the Shizuoka prefecture area, and who survived for more than 3 months after the start of hemodialysis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Nothing particular.

overall_official.affiliation: First Department of Medicine, Hamamatsu University School of Medicine

clinical_study.keyword: The relationship between all-cause mortality in patients introduced hemodialysis and recombinant human erythropoietin dose and serum adiponectin level
